data.title: The Dark Pictures Anthology: House of Ashes Teaser Traile(2021) | Starring Ashley Tisdale(High School Musical)
data.meta_description:
A teaser trailer for the next game of the Dark Pictures Anthology was shown at the end of Little Hope:
(Taken from a random youtube channel, you can find...
data.text:
Judging by the comments in this thread, have neither of the other two games in the anthology been good? The idea of the anthology was interesting to me but I haven't played either of the first two yet

Judging by the comments in this thread, have neither of the other two games in the anthology been good? The idea of the anthology was interesting to me but I haven't played either of the first two yet

Neither have managed to be as good as until dawn.

Judging by the comments in this thread, have neither of the other two games in the anthology been good? The idea of the anthology was interesting to me but I haven't played either of the first two yet

Haven't played Little Hope yet, but Man of Medan was fairly disappointing. It felt like it tried too hard to be clever with the premise, but I realized what was going on about two minutes into the main location. It didn't help that the actual premise was a major letdown.

Plus, it didn't have the same magic with the characters as Until Dawn. Nothing lived up to Michael.

Judging by the comments in this thread, have neither of the other two games in the anthology been good? The idea of the anthology was interesting to me but I haven't played either of the first two yet

I've only played Man of Medan but it was like Until Dawn without any self-awareness.

Judging by the comments in this thread, have neither of the other two games in the anthology been good? The idea of the anthology was interesting to me but I haven't played either of the first two yet

Man of Medan was a fun jaunt with friends.

All the characters are very unlikeable though.

I kept hearing that the games are not that good due to budget issues, is hiring a "known" actor for VA really a good use of the little they have? maybe im just overestimating the costs of getting Tisdale on board though

I kept hearing that the games are not that good due to budget issues, is hiring a "known" actor for VA really a good use of the little they have? maybe im just overestimating the costs of getting Tisdale on board though

Having good performances is really important for a game like this though, so I don't think it's a bad use of their budget.

And the games have been perfectly enjoyable so far If you don't go in expecting something as meaty as Until Dawn.

I kept hearing that the games are not that good due to budget issues, is hiring a "known" actor for VA really a good use of the little they have? maybe im just overestimating the costs of getting Tisdale on board though

I'm not sure if it's so much a budget issue as it is that the writing/story of both games so far simply aren't nearly as good as Until Dawn's

Graphically, they're all really good. They just simply just need better writing

Judging by the comments in this thread, have neither of the other two games in the anthology been good? The idea of the anthology was interesting to me but I haven't played either of the first two yet

They aren't as good as Until Dawn but they aren't terrible either. I would say they are 6/10, maybe 7/10 games, depending on how much you like these types of games.

They are also smaller, budget priced games compared to Until Dawn.

Looks cool!

Judging by the comments in this thread, have neither of the other two games in the anthology been good? The idea of the anthology was interesting to me but I haven't played either of the first two yet

I liked them both a lot, with the slight edge going to Little Hope. Give them a shot, Man of Medan has to be super cheap I would think.

You played Until Dawn right?

Press release with some additional details (via IGN):

"Iraq, 2003," a press release for House of Ashes reads. "As the conflict draws to a close, CIA field operative Rachel King joins an elite military unit on a raid of a suspected underground chemical weapons facility in the shadow of the Zagros Mountains."

Once King and her unit arrive at the coordinates, they're ambushed by a local patrol led by Sergeant Salim Othman. An earthquake opens sinkholes in the ground during their ensuing firefight and both sides of the fight are tossed into the ruins of a buried Sumerian temple. In the darkness beneath the Arabian Desert, something evil is awakened, the press release reads, and ancient, unstoppable creatures begin their hunt.

The Dark Pictures Anthology: House of Ashes Is a Horror Game Set in the Iraq War - IGN

The next game in the Dark Pictures Anthology, House of Ashes, is a game set during the Iraq War and it's coming next year.

Sounds cool, the teaser at the end of Little Hope gave me The Descent in the desert vibes.
